3dprinter.definition: A device that creates three-dimensional objects from digital files, used in assistive technology to create tactile models and adaptive devices

3dprinting.definition: The process of creating three-dimensional objects from digital files, widely used in assistive technology for creating tactile learning materials

accessibility.definition: The design of products, devices, services, or environments to be usable by people with disabilities

accessiblematerials.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

accessiblemath.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

ada.definition: Americans with Disabilities Act - US civil rights law prohibiting discrimination based on disability

ai.definition: Artificial Intelligence - computer systems that perform tasks typically requiring human intelligence, increasingly used in accessibility applications

alttext.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

api.definition: Application Programming Interface - protocols that enable software accessibility features

apps.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

artificialintelligence.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

assistivetechnology.definition: Any item, piece of equipment, or system used to increase, maintain, or improve functional capabilities of individuals with disabilities

audio.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

audiobook.definition: Digital audio recordings of books, providing accessible reading alternatives

auditoryfeedback.definition: Sound-based responses that provide information about system status and user actions

bana.definition: Braille Authority of North America - organization that promotes braille literacy and standardization

bluetooth.definition: Wireless communication technology for short-range connections

bmml.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

bookshare.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

braille.definition: A tactile writing system using raised dots that allows people who are blind to read and write through touch

brailledisplay.definition: A tactile electronic device that displays braille characters by raising and lowering pins, allowing blind users to read screen content

brailleeducation.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

brailleembosser.definition: A printer that creates braille text on paper by embossing raised dots, essential for producing hard-copy braille materials

brailleliteracy.definition: The ability to read and write braille, essential for academic success of blind students

charts.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

cognitiveload.definition: The amount of mental effort required to complete a task, which can be increased by poorly designed interfaces

communication.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

cpu.definition: Central Processing Unit - the main processor of a computer, critical for smooth assistive technology operation

cvi.definition: Cortical Visual Impairment - a visual impairment caused by damage to the visual pathways in the brain

dailylivingaids.definition: Assistive devices that help people with disabilities perform everyday tasks independently

daisy.definition: Digital Accessible Information System - a standard for creating accessible digital talking books

datavisualization.definition: The presentation of data in visual formats, requiring alternative accessible representations

digitalaccessibility.definition: The design of digital technology to be usable by people with disabilities

digitalliteracy.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

documentstructure.definition: The organization and markup of documents to ensure they are navigable by assistive technology

ebooks.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

educationalequity.definition: The principle that all students, including those with disabilities, should have equal access to educational opportunities and resources

equitableaccess.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

fileformats.definition: Different ways of encoding and storing digital information, with varying levels of accessibility

fonts.definition: Typeface designs that affect readability for users with visual impairments

formulas.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

gps.definition: Global Positioning System - satellite-based navigation technology adapted for use by people with visual impairments

graphingcalculator.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

haptic.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

hapticfeedback.definition: Touch-based feedback through vibration or force, providing non-visual information to users

hardware.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

html.definition: HyperText Markup Language - the standard markup language for creating accessible web pages

imagesandmedia.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

inclusivedesign.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

independence.definition: The ability to perform tasks and make decisions without assistance, supported by appropriate assistive technology

independentlivingskills.definition: Abilities needed to live independently, often supported by assistive technology

indoornavigation.definition: Technology systems that provide navigation assistance inside buildings where GPS is not available

instructionalmaterials.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

interactivegraphingenvironments.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

jaws.definition: Job Access With Speech - a commercial screen reader software developed by Freedom Scientific

laptop.definition: A portable computer that, when properly configured, serves as the primary computing platform for students using assistive technology

latency.definition: The delay between user input and system response, particularly critical for screen reader users who rely on immediate audio feedback

latex.definition: A document preparation system used for high-quality typesetting, particularly useful for mathematical and scientific documents

llm.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

machinelearning.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

magnification.definition: Technology that enlarges visual content for users with low vision

markdown.definition: A lightweight markup language that can be easily converted to accessible formats including braille

mathml.definition: Mathematical Markup Language - a markup language for describing mathematical notation in a screen reader accessible way

mathocr.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

mobility.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

music.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

musicbraille.definition: A braille code system for representing musical notation tactilely

musicxml.definition: A digital format for representing musical notation that can be converted to accessible formats

narrator.definition: Microsoft's built-in screen reader for Windows operating systems

navigation.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

neuralnetwork.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

nimac.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

nimas.definition: National Instructional Materials Accessibility Standard - a US standard for creating accessible instructional materials

nlg.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

notetaker.definition: Braille notetaker device combining braille display with note-taking and computing functions

nvda.definition: NonVisual Desktop Access - a free, open-source screen reader for Windows

ocr.definition: Optical Character Recognition - technology that converts images of text into machine-readable and screen reader accessible text

officesuite.definition: Microsoft Office suite applications with accessibility features for document creation and editing

omr.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

opensource.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

operatingsystem.definition: System software that manages computer hardware and provides services for applications, with built-in accessibility features

opticalcharacterrecognition.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

orientation.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

orientationmobility.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

pdf.definition: Portable Document Format - a file format that can be made accessible through proper tagging and structure

presentations.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

processor.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

programminglanguages.definition: Computer languages used to create software, including accessibility-focused applications

ram.definition: Random Access Memory - computer memory that significantly impacts screen reader performance and responsiveness

safety.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

screenreader.definition: Software that reads screen content aloud and provides keyboard navigation for users who are blind or have low vision

section508.definition: A US law requiring federal agencies to make electronic and information technology accessible

settframework.definition: Student, Environment, Tasks, and Tools - a framework for assistive technology assessment and selection

situationalawareness.definition: The perception and understanding of one's environment, supported by assistive technology for users with visual impairments

software.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

sonification.definition: The use of sound to convey information, particularly useful for representing data to users who are blind

speechsynthesis.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

stem.definition: Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics - educational disciplines that require specialized accessibility considerations

tablet.definition: A portable touchscreen computing device that offers accessible interfaces and specialized apps for users with visual impairments

tactile.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

tactilegraphics.definition: Raised images and diagrams that can be read through touch, providing visual information to users who are blind

technology.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

textformatting.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

texttospeech.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

troubleshooting.definition: The process of identifying and resolving problems with assistive technology

tts.definition: Text-to-Speech - technology that converts written text into spoken audio output

typography.definition: The art and technique of arranging type to make written language legible and appealing

usb.definition: Universal Serial Bus - standard for connecting devices to computers

videomagnifier.definition: A device that uses a camera and display to magnify text and objects for users with low vision

visualimpairment.definition: A condition affecting vision that requires adaptive techniques or assistive technology for accessing information

wcag.definition: Web Content Accessibility Guidelines - international standards for making web content accessible to people with disabilities

webaccessibility.definition: The practice of making websites usable by people with disabilities

webaim.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility

xml.definition: eXtensible Markup Language - markup language for encoding documents

zoom.definition: A specialized term in assistive technology and accessibility
